content: Stretch your shoulders. Place the back of one hand in the small of your back. With your opposite hand, grab your elbow, gently pull forward, and hold. Repeat with opposite side. Stretch your triceps. [1] Reach up with one arm. Bend your elbow and put your forearm down behind your head and between your shoulder blades. With your opposite arm, reach up and grab your raised elbow. Pull your elbow toward your head. Repeat with other arm. Stretch your biceps. Put your arms straight out to your sides with your thumbs facing up. Rotate your arms so that your thumbs face straight back, then rotate them forward until your thumbs are facing straight down. Stretch your wrists. Hold one arm out in front of you with your elbow bent (and close to your body) and palm facing up. With your opposite hand, grab your fingertips and slowly pull them all the way down until that hand is now facing the floor. Continue to pull on your fingertips, now in an upward direction since your palm is facing down. Repeat with other hand. Stretch your quadriceps. Stand up and pull one leg behind you (flamingo position). Once holding onto your foot, continue to apply upward pressure. Repeat with other leg. Stretch your calves. Place one leg in front of the other (split stance) with your hands on your hips. Lean slightly forward as you begin to straighten your back leg, ideally bringing your back foot all the way flat against the floor. Repeat with other leg. Stretch your hamstrings. Sit on the floor with both feet out in front of you. Reach out with both arms, ideally grabbing onto your toes and holding. Stretch your hips. Lie flat on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Get into a figure four position by placing one ankle on your opposite knee. Reach through and around your knee, clasp, pull it toward you, and hold. Repeat with opposite side. Stretch your groin. Sit on the floor. Press the soles of your feet together (butterfly position). Pull your feet as close to your body as possible. Put your hands on your ankles to where your elbows are lined up with your knees. Push against your elbows trying to close your legs. (This contracts your groin muscles to help you get a deeper stretch.) Push your knees down. Stretch your upper back. Clasp your hands together and reach your arms forward directly in front of your chest as far as possible. Allow your upper back to become round and your chin to drop toward your chest. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds. Stretch your chest. [2] Stand approximately 2 feet (61 cm) back from the interior corner of a wall, facing the corner. Position your feet to be about shoulder-width apart. Place one forearm on each wall with your elbows resting just above the height of your shoulders. Lean forward as far as you comfortably can. Hold in this position for 30-60 seconds. Stretch your neck. Incline your head forward, but do not roll your head from side to side as this can be harmful. Instead, stretch your neck to the left, right, forward and back, but always return to center first! Tilt your head with the ear toward the shoulder and hold the tilt for 20-30 seconds. Focus on your breathing and relaxing your neck and shoulder muscles during this time. Be sure that while your head is tilted back, you keep your jaw relaxed and even let your mouth fall open just a bit. Stretch your jaw. Incline your head back, rest your chin on your palm, and pull your jaw open. Say "Ah!" (you can mime it). Grab your chin with your thumb, index and middle fingers. Stretch it left to right. This exercise will help if you have been hit to the jaw (e.g., knocked-out in boxing). Never stretch before you warm up. The only reason it feels good to stretch even when you're cold is because your body sends out natural painkillers. To protect your tissues, you need to raise your cardiac pulse in order to fill them with blood. The only way to do this is by working out. [3] Swimming is the safest way to raise your cardiac pulse. Water reduces shocks to the body because it reduces the felt effect of gravity on your body. Jumping rope can also be effective, but it may damage your tibia's periosteums, which is the membrane enveloping your bones (except at junctions) that allows the blood to flow from your heart to your muscles connected by the tendon. [4] Swimming pools are sometimes inaccessible, so an efficient and safe way to raise cardiac pulse would be by cycling (except if you have knee problems). Stretching before your workout will put your Central Nervous System (CNS) to sleep to increase your range of motion. It will result with less gain than improvement on the muscle part. The CNS naturally provides resistance by stimulating antagonists muscles when you flex a muscle to prevent it from being too stretched and tear your conjunctive tissues. Never stretch prior to workout, and always do it after. [5] Always stretch after you work out. Stretching will ensure you have an optimal circulation of body fluids throughout your system and an adequate flexibility which will prevent your connective tissues to pop when you contract your muscle. [6]

<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Stretch">How to Stretch</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Stretching_Exercises_sub" id="">Stretching Exercises</a>

<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan">Michele Dolan</a>. Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">10 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>Stretching correctly will increase your flexibility and reduce the risk of injuries caused by lesions of the connective tissues (such as the periosteum) and other nasty things. This guide shows a variety of techniques with the goal of revamping or establishing your stretching routine. Use the tips that suit your needs for the activities you do. <b>If you are injured, do not stretch without the help of a physical therapist. Doing so may result in further injury.</b></p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Stretching_Exercises_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Stretching_Exercises">Stretching Exercises</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=54461" href="#/Image:Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" height="410" id="img_ceb87243b4" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ceb87243b4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-1-Version-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your shoulders.</b>
<ul>
<li>Place the back of one hand in the small of your back.</li>
<li>With your opposite hand, grab your elbow, gently pull forward, and hold.</li>
<li>Repeat with opposite side.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/e5/Stretch-Step-2-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/2/2c/Stretch-Step-2-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Stretch-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-2-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/f/fb/Stretch Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-48248b68ac" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your triceps.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-48248b68ac'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Reach up with one arm.</li>
<li>Bend your elbow and put your forearm down behind your head and between your shoulder blades.</li>
<li>With your opposite arm, reach up and grab your raised elbow.</li>
<li>Pull your elbow toward your head.</li>
<li>Repeat with other arm.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/93/Stretch-Step-3-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/ad/Stretch-Step-3-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Stretch-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-3-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/9/90/Stretch Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-0114151b90" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your biceps.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-0114151b90'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Put your arms straight out to your sides with your thumbs facing up.</li>
<li>Rotate your arms so that your thumbs face straight back, then rotate them forward until your thumbs are facing straight down.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0b/Stretch-Step-4-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/78/Stretch-Step-4-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Stretch-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-4-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/5/5d/Stretch Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-3112f9427f" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your wrists.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-3112f9427f'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Hold one arm out in front of you with your elbow bent (and close to your body) and palm facing up.</li>
<li>With your opposite hand, grab your fingertips and slowly pull them all the way down until that hand is now facing the floor.</li>
<li>Continue to pull on your fingertips, now in an upward direction since your palm is facing down.</li>
<li>Repeat with other hand.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b2/Stretch-Step-5-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/3b/Stretch-Step-5-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b9/Stretch-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-5-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/f/fc/Stretch Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-ac36a9be2d" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your quadriceps.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-ac36a9be2d'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Stand up and pull one leg behind you (flamingo position).</li>
<li>Once holding onto your foot, continue to apply upward pressure.</li>
<li>Repeat with other leg.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f3/Stretch-Step-6-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/43/Stretch-Step-6-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Stretch-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-6-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/0/0b/Stretch Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-a6a15afc3c" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your calves.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-a6a15afc3c'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Place one leg in front of the other (split stance) with your hands on your hips.</li>
<li>Lean slightly forward as you begin to straighten your back leg, ideally bringing your back foot all the way flat against the floor.</li>
<li>Repeat with other leg.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f4/Stretch-Step-7-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/79/Stretch-Step-7-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Stretch-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-7-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/0/0a/Stretch Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-d1e1f3d8b0" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your hamstrings.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-d1e1f3d8b0'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Sit on the floor with both feet out in front of you.</li>
<li>Reach out with both arms, ideally grabbing onto your toes and holding.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/8/83/Stretch-Step-8-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/9c/Stretch-Step-8-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Stretch-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-8-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/9/95/Stretch Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-d1a3c3ffd7" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your hips.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-d1a3c3ffd7'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Lie flat on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.</li>
<li>Get into a figure four position by placing one ankle on your opposite knee.</li>
<li>Reach through and around your knee, clasp, pull it toward you, and hold.</li>
<li>Repeat with opposite side.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a9/Stretch-Step-9-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a9/Stretch-Step-9-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Stretch-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-9-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/8/8c/Stretch Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-b1939ae651" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your groin.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-b1939ae651'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Sit on the floor.</li>
<li>Press the soles of your feet together (butterfly position).</li>
<li>Pull your feet as close to your body as possible.</li>
<li>Put your hands on your ankles to where your elbows are lined up with your knees.</li>
<li>Push against your elbows trying to close your legs. (This contracts your groin muscles to help you get a deeper stretch.)</li>
<li>Push your knees down.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Stretch-Step-10-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/4b/Stretch-Step-10-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Stretch-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-10-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/3/30/Stretch Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-1e3cc6f020" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 10" class="step_num">10</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_10"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your upper back.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-1e3cc6f020'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Clasp your hands together and reach your arms forward directly in front of your chest as far as possible.</li>
<li>Allow your upper back to become round and your chin to drop toward your chest.</li>
<li>Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li>
<div aria-label="Step 11" class="step_num">11</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_11"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your chest.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup><ul>
<li>Stand approximately 2 feet (61 cm) back from the interior corner of a wall, facing the corner. Position your feet to be about shoulder-width apart.</li>
<li>Place one forearm on each wall with your elbows resting just above the height of your shoulders.</li>
<li>Lean forward as far as you comfortably can. Hold in this position for 30-60 seconds.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/57/Stretch-Step-11-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b9/Stretch-Step-11-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Stretch-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-11-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/9/93/Stretch Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-4dbd933f26" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 12" class="step_num">12</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_12"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your neck.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-4dbd933f26'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Incline your head forward, but do not roll your head from side to side as this can be harmful. Instead, stretch your neck to the left, right, forward and back, but always return to center first!</li>
<li>Tilt your head with the ear toward the shoulder and hold the tilt for 20-30 seconds. Focus on your breathing and relaxing your neck and shoulder muscles during this time.</li>
<li>Be sure that while your head is tilted back, you keep your jaw relaxed and even let your mouth fall open just a bit.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b4/Stretch-Step-12-Version-2.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/53/Stretch-Step-12-Version-2.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Stretch-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-12-Version-3.jpg" data-src="/0/0e/Stretch Step 12 Version 2.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-ea65428bc5" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 13" class="step_num">13</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_13"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretch your jaw.</b><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-ea65428bc5'));
//]]>
</script>
<ul>
<li>Incline your head back, rest your chin on your palm, and pull your jaw open.</li>
<li>Say "Ah!" (you can mime it).</li>
<li>Grab your chin with your thumb, index and middle fingers.</li>
<li>Stretch it left to right. This exercise will help if you have been hit to the jaw (e.g., knocked-out in boxing).</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">

</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="When_To_Stretch_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="When_To_Stretch">When To Stretch</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=54461" href="#/Image:Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8a/Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_87745d4fb4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_87745d4fb4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8a/Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Never stretch before you warm up.</b> The only reason it feels good to stretch even when you're cold is because your body sends out natural painkillers. To protect your tissues, you need to raise your cardiac pulse in order to fill them with blood. The only way to do this is by working out.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Swimming is the safest way to raise your cardiac pulse. Water reduces shocks to the body because it reduces the felt effect of gravity on your body.</li>
<li>Jumping rope can also be effective, but it may damage your tibia's periosteums, which is the membrane enveloping your bones (except at junctions) that allows the blood to flow from your heart to your muscles connected by the tendon.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Swimming pools are sometimes inaccessible, so an efficient and safe way to raise cardiac pulse would be by cycling (except if you have knee problems).</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=54461" href="#/Image:Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="410" id="img_43760ec3ca" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_43760ec3ca')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Stretch Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="410" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid54461-v4-728px-Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Stretching before your workout will put your Central Nervous System (CNS) to sleep to increase your range of motion.</b> It will result with less gain than improvement on the muscle part. The CNS naturally provides resistance by stimulating antagonists muscles when you flex a muscle to prevent it from being too stretched and tear your conjunctive tissues. <b>Never stretch prior to workout, and always do it after.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup></b>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatright" style="max-width:728px"><div class="content-spacer" style="padding-top: 56.25%;"><div class="video-player">
<div class="video-container content-fill"><video class="m-video content-fill" controlslist="nodownload" data-controls="1" data-giffirstsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/52/Stretch-Step-15.360p.first.gif" data-gifsrc="https://www.wikihow.com/images/d/d9/Stretch-Step-15.360p.gif" data-poster="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Stretch-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/550px-nowatermark-Stretch-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" data-src="/5/55/Stretch Step 15.360p.mp4" data-watermark="1" id="mvid-153e933d48" loop="" muted="" playsinline="" webkit-playsinline=""></video></div>
<div class="m-video-controls"><div class="m-video-play-old"></div></div>
<div class="m-video-wm" data-wm-title-text="to Stretch"><img class="m-video-wm-img" src="/skins/WikiHow/images/WH_logo.svg"/></div>
</div></div></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Always stretch after you work out.</b> Stretching will ensure you have an optimal circulation of body fluids throughout your system and an adequate flexibility which will prevent your connective tissues to pop when you contract your muscle.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup><script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
if (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-153e933d48'));
//]]>
</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,4805470868" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="54461" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="226111" data-caid="226984" data-cqid="226128" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1369777" data-submitter_id="4088798" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="28">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can we do stretching before breakfast?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_ta_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://www.wikihow.com/images/avatarOut/5/55/4088798.jpg?20170215114325)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Irdanwen">Tom De Backer</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Top Answerer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Sure, there's nothing wrong with that. In fact, it will help start your metabolism because it gets the blood flowing, giving you a healthy appetite and making you ready for the day.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>2</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>28</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="67156" data-caid="68029" data-cqid="67173" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="578671" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="14" data-votes_up="94">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can stretching help me with splits?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Stretching increases flexibility in your joints which can make it easier to do the splits.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>14</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>94</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="20958" data-caid="21831" data-cqid="20975" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="161439" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="26" data-votes_up="138">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I become flexible?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">It is best if you stretch daily, and as you stretch, try to push yourself a little further every day. For example, if you are working on your sideways splits, try to spread you legs a little further every day. But do not stretch so far that it begins to hurt. Doing so can cause tissue scarring, higher resting muscle tone, etc. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>26</span></a>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Stretch every day in order to become flexible more quickly.</li>
<li>Try not to stretch too hard if you are a beginner you need to get used to stretching so you can be flexible, if you start out by stretching too much that will cause injury.</li>
<li>Create a daily stretching routine.</li>
<li>Wear stretchy clothes.</li>
<li>Perform the exercises slowly to prevent injuries.</li>
<li>You should stretch as far as you are comfortable when inhaling, and when exhaling, go a little farther than comfortable. This increases flexibility when used as a daily routine.</li>
<li>Do not bounce or bob when you stretch - this is not effective and may lead to injury.</li>
<li>If some stretches are difficult at beginner level, you might want to use a wall for support, or the assistance of a friend.</li>
<li>Exercise Carefully to avoid injury</li>
<li>Breathe in a natural rhythm, and stay calm. Don't stretch if you are injured.</li>
<li>Remember that you shouldn't feel pain when stretching, just the stretches of the muscles. If you feel pain, stop, rest for a moment, then continue, but be more careful.</li>
<li>Learn to love the 'pain' of stretching.</li>
<li>Eat healthy. This will help when you are stretching.</li>
<li>Don't exercise to much. it will cause injury.</li>
<li>Stretch so you can feel it, but stretch comfortably, never force a stretch or you will injure yourself.</li>
<li>Stretch as much as you can before a sport! Remember, you can never be too loose.</li>
<li>Stop a stretch immediately if it hurts. At most, stretching should cause mild discomfort, never significant physical pain.</li>
<li>Listening to calm music will help you to relax and do your stretches more easily. Try <a href="/Appreciate-Classical-Music" title="Appreciate Classical Music">classical music</a>; it's very soothing.</li>
<li>All stretches should be held, without movement, for 15-20 seconds. This surpasses the myotatic reflex which prevents any muscle from stretching for the first 10-12 seconds.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>Each individual possesses her or his own physical limitations when exercising. Be sure that you acknowledge your physical restrictions while stretching, ensuring that you do not induce injury in your efforts to exercise. Remember, your well-being is at the center of each exercise activity.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>
<b>Never</b> stretch when you are injured.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To stretch your back, start by clasping your hands together and reaching your arms out directly in front of you. Then, round your shoulders, drop your chin to your chest, and hold for 30 seconds. If you want to stretch your legs, sit on the floor with both of your feet out in front of you and reach for your toes with your hands. You can also stand up and pull one of your legs up behind you, hold, and then repeat with your other leg. <span id="summary_last_sentence">To learn how to stretch other parts of your body, like your shoulders and arms, keep reading!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
    "@type": "HowTo",
    "headline": "Stretch",
    "name": "Stretch",
    "mainEntityOfPage": {
        "@type": "WebPage",
        "id": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/Stretch"
    },
    "image": {
        "@type": "ImageObject",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\/aid54461-v4-1200px-Stretch-Step-14-Version-2.jpg",
        "width": 1200,
        "height": 675
    },
    "author": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/company\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "aggregateRating": {
        "@type": "AggregateRating",
        "bestRating": 100,
        "ratingCount": 53,
        "ratingValue": 85
    },
    "datePublished": "2006-08-09",
    "dateModified": "2019-04-17",
    "publisher": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",
        "name": "wikiHow",
        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/skins\/owl\/images\/wikihow_logo_name_green_60.png",
            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },
        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/company\/wikihow\/",
            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "contributor": {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "Michele Dolan"
    },
    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Stretching Exercises",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your shoulders.\n\nPlace the back of one hand in the small of your back.\nWith your opposite hand, grab your elbow, gently pull forward, and hold.\nRepeat with opposite side."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your triceps.[1]\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-48248b68ac'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nReach up with one arm.\nBend your elbow and put your forearm down behind your head and between your shoulder blades.\nWith your opposite arm, reach up and grab your raised elbow.\nPull your elbow toward your head.\nRepeat with other arm."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your biceps.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-0114151b90'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nPut your arms straight out to your sides with your thumbs facing up.\nRotate your arms so that your thumbs face straight back, then rotate them forward until your thumbs are facing straight down."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your wrists.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-3112f9427f'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nHold one arm out in front of you with your elbow bent (and close to your body) and palm facing up.\nWith your opposite hand, grab your fingertips and slowly pull them all the way down until that hand is now facing the floor.\nContinue to pull on your fingertips, now in an upward direction since your palm is facing down.\nRepeat with other hand."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your quadriceps.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-ac36a9be2d'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nStand up and pull one leg behind you (flamingo position).\nOnce holding onto your foot, continue to apply upward pressure.\nRepeat with other leg."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your calves.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-a6a15afc3c'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nPlace one leg in front of the other (split stance) with your hands on your hips.\nLean slightly forward as you begin to straighten your back leg, ideally bringing your back foot all the way flat against the floor.\nRepeat with other leg."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 7,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your hamstrings.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-d1e1f3d8b0'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nSit on the floor with both feet out in front of you.\nReach out with both arms, ideally grabbing onto your toes and holding."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 8,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your hips.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-d1a3c3ffd7'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nLie flat on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.\nGet into a figure four position by placing one ankle on your opposite knee.\nReach through and around your knee, clasp, pull it toward you, and hold.\nRepeat with opposite side."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 9,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your groin.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-b1939ae651'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nSit on the floor.\nPress the soles of your feet together (butterfly position).\nPull your feet as close to your body as possible.\nPut your hands on your ankles to where your elbows are lined up with your knees.\nPush against your elbows trying to close your legs. (This contracts your groin muscles to help you get a deeper stretch.)\nPush your knees down."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 10,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your upper back.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-1e3cc6f020'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nClasp your hands together and reach your arms forward directly in front of your chest as far as possible.\nAllow your upper back to become round and your chin to drop toward your chest.\nHold this position for 15-30 seconds."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 11,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your chest.[2]Stand approximately 2 feet (61\u00a0cm) back from the interior corner of a wall, facing the corner. Position your feet to be about shoulder-width apart.\nPlace one forearm on each wall with your elbows resting just above the height of your shoulders.\nLean forward as far as you comfortably can. Hold in this position for 30-60 seconds."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 12,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Stretch your neck.\n\/\/<![CDATA[\nif (WH.video)WH.video.add(document.getElementById('mvid-4dbd933f26'));\n\/\/]]>\n\nIncline your head forward, but do not roll your head from side to side as this can be harmful. Instead, stretch your neck to the left, right, forward and back, but always return to center first!\nTilt your head with the ear toward the shoulder and hold the tilt for 20-30 seconds. Focus on your breathing and relaxing your neck and shoulder muscles during this time.\nBe sure that while your head is tilted back, you keep your jaw relaxed and even let your mouth fall open just a bit."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 13,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,

title: How to Stretch
content_html:
Stretch your shoulders.
  • Place the back of one hand in the small of your back.
  • With your opposite hand, grab your elbow, gently pull forward, and hold.
  • Repeat with opposite side.
Stretch your triceps.[1]
  • Reach up with one arm.
  • Bend your elbow and put your forearm down behind your head and between your shoulder blades.
  • With your opposite arm, reach up and grab your raised elbow.
  • Pull your elbow toward your head.
  • Repeat with other arm.
Stretch your biceps.
  • Put your arms straight out to your sides with your thumbs facing up.
  • Rotate your arms so that your thumbs face straight back, then rotate them forward until your thumbs are facing straight down.
Stretch your wrists.
  • Hold one arm out in front of you with your elbow bent (and close to your body) and palm facing up.
  • With your opposite hand, grab your fingertips and slowly pull them all the way down until that hand is now facing the floor.
  • Continue to pull on your fingertips, now in an upward direction since your palm is facing down.
  • Repeat with other hand.
Stretch your quadriceps.
  • Stand up and pull one leg behind you (flamingo position).
  • Once holding onto your foot, continue to apply upward pressure.
  • Repeat with other leg.
Stretch your calves.
  • Place one leg in front of the other (split stance) with your hands on your hips.
  • Lean slightly forward as you begin to straighten your back leg, ideally bringing your back foot all the way flat against the floor.
  • Repeat with other leg.
Stretch your hamstrings.
  • Sit on the floor with both feet out in front of you.
  • Reach out with both arms, ideally grabbing onto your toes and holding.
Stretch your hips.
  • Lie flat on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
  • Get into a figure four position by placing one ankle on your opposite knee.
  • Reach through and around your knee, clasp, pull it toward you, and hold.
  • Repeat with opposite side.
Stretch your groin.
  • Sit on the floor.
  • Press the soles of your feet together (butterfly position).
  • Pull your feet as close to your body as possible.
  • Put your hands on your ankles to where your elbows are lined up with your knees.
  • Push against your elbows trying to close your legs. (This contracts your groin muscles to help you get a deeper stretch.)
  • Push your knees down.
Stretch your upper back.
  • Clasp your hands together and reach your arms forward directly in front of your chest as far as possible.
  • Allow your upper back to become round and your chin to drop toward your chest.
  • Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.
Stretch your chest.[2]
  • Stand approximately 2 feet (61 cm) back from the interior corner of a wall, facing the corner. Position your feet to be about shoulder-width apart.
  • Place one forearm on each wall with your elbows resting just above the height of your shoulders.
  • Lean forward as far as you comfortably can. Hold in this position for 30-60 seconds.
Stretch your neck.
  • Incline your head forward, but do not roll your head from side to side as this can be harmful. Instead, stretch your neck to the left, right, forward and back, but always return to center first!
  • Tilt your head with the ear toward the shoulder and hold the tilt for 20-30 seconds. Focus on your breathing and relaxing your neck and shoulder muscles during this time.
  • Be sure that while your head is tilted back, you keep your jaw relaxed and even let your mouth fall open just a bit.
Stretch your jaw.
  • Incline your head back, rest your chin on your palm, and pull your jaw open.
  • Say "Ah!" (you can mime it).
  • Grab your chin with your thumb, index and middle fingers.
  • Stretch it left to right. This exercise will help if you have been hit to the jaw (e.g., knocked-out in boxing).
Never stretch before you warm up. The only reason it feels good to stretch even when you're cold is because your body sends out natural painkillers. To protect your tissues, you need to raise your cardiac pulse in order to fill them with blood. The only way to do this is by working out.[3]
  • Swimming is the safest way to raise your cardiac pulse. Water reduces shocks to the body because it reduces the felt effect of gravity on your body.
  • Jumping rope can also be effective, but it may damage your tibia's periosteums, which is the membrane enveloping your bones (except at junctions) that allows the blood to flow from your heart to your muscles connected by the tendon.[4]
  • Swimming pools are sometimes inaccessible, so an efficient and safe way to raise cardiac pulse would be by cycling (except if you have knee problems).
Stretching before your workout will put your Central Nervous System (CNS) to sleep to increase your range of motion. It will result with less gain than improvement on the muscle part. The CNS naturally provides resistance by stimulating antagonists muscles when you flex a muscle to prevent it from being too stretched and tear your conjunctive tissues. Never stretch prior to workout, and always do it after.[5]
Always stretch after you work out. Stretching will ensure you have an optimal circulation of body fluids throughout your system and an adequate flexibility which will prevent your connective tissues to pop when you contract your muscle.[6]
